definition: (lit.) gathering place of fish or other creatures/(fig.) haunt/lair/nest/den/hotbed

sentences.english: The literature of the 19th century is rich with great travel writing.
sentences.chinese: 19世纪的文学是游记名篇的渊薮。

sentences.english: I become more and more perplexed in the direction of beauty .
sentences.chinese: 渊薮中的生活，让我越发困惑于美的定向。

sentences.english: Living in the abysms , I become more and more perplexed in the direction of beauty .
sentences.chinese: 渊薮中的生活，让我越发困惑于美的定向。

sentences.english: The Master Hashashim's' Guild house is a den of delights and death.
sentences.chinese: 哈萨辛大师行会是狞笑和死亡的渊薮。

sentences.english: The sea is the inexorable social night into which the penal laws fling their condemned.
sentences.chinese: 海，就是冷酷无情的法律抛掷它牺牲品的总渊薮。

sentences.english: Destroy the cavern Ignorance and you destroy the lair Crime.
sentences.chinese: 摧毁这个无知窟窖，那罪恶渊薮也就毁灭掉了。

sentences.english: I'm responsible for my life; I alone am the creator of my results.
sentences.chinese: 我应该对自己的行为负责，我是一切事情的渊薮。

sentences.english: This plague spot of civilization ought to be abolished with all possible speed.
sentences.chinese: 文明的这种罪恶的渊薮，应当尽快加以消灭。

definition: lit. floating wine goblets on a stream/the origin (of some phenomenon)
a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
there is a reason for it/(of sth) not incidental
the whole world/throughout the land/everything under the sun
to sink into oblivion/to be lost to memory/to vanish
